reviewText:
After a little more than 1 hour of playing, my jaw is still dangling at my chest. Please..Please tell me that this is an early development, pre-alpha release.
I am all pro indie development, and it is only fair that everybody with a game on their mind gets a chance to show there creations to the world, but please.. please have an actual product when you start to release, even if it is an early access product, as are the majority of games I usually opt in for, if they have my interest in the first place.

You can get FREE web based games in the Roblox engine primarily made by 13 year old kids, with better UI, Graphics, Sound, Animation, Player Controls - and the list goes on..

Wow - for the first time in my Steam life, I am actually going to ask for a refund.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

eldrarak82, - im gonna do it this way instead of another comment, since they must be less than a 1000 characters..

The sound of the air when gliding is a one take loop that gets pretty ugly to listen too after 20 min,

The sound of the vario only kicks in when you hit one of the square" static thermal bubbles so no ridge flying here.

Thermal square boxes may not provide you lift unless you spiral violently when you pass through them

reviewText:
Seriously, this game for a tenner ( 10bucks ).

It is a ok game but I expected more than this.

First of all, the graphics are not that good as it stands 3D.

Lag is a main problem in the main menu.

Loading screens are random main menu picures.

RIP Phyics.

Not a 10 quids game.
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
While it's not the greatest game ever or even that great of an idea in general. I did have quite a good few laughs during my idle session for the achievements. This game certainly does reach new heights, just not quite the heights you where expecting.

More along the lines of being stuck in the sky...

If you're gonna get this, wait for it to appear in a bundle again or grab it during a sale. Hopefully the developer fixes the bugs and makes this something worth playing because the game described on the notice board at the start of the game sounds appealing. Nothing that's going to make me jump out of my seat but hopefully will be a bit more fun than what it is right now. Still, the developer is a cool guy and is still working on fixing the game up so I won't judge too harshly at this moment in time.

I've yet to try out the multiplayer aspects of the game but will update my review when I get round to it.
